title: mitty_(made_in_abyss)
body:
[b]Mitty[/b] is a character from [[Made in Abyss]], voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]].

Mitty is an amorphous [[creature]] that lives with [[Nanachi (made_in_abyss)|]] in The Abyss. Mitty's body is covered in pink fur; has two cat-like ears protruding from her head and claws on the end of her arms; her mouth is split upwards and she is missing her left eye. [spoilers]She was originally a human.[/spoilers]

title: netorase
body:
A fetish involving one of the party of the lovers intentionally  manipulating the situation so that their partner will end up raped by the third party, or just flat out convinces/orders her to have sex with them against their will.

Not to be confused with the similarly worded, "[[Netorare]] (寝取られ, also NTR)."

If both parties consent to have the third party involved, use [[swinging (relationship)]] instead. If the party who is having sexual relationship with the third party consent without their partner's acknowledgement, uses [[cheating (relationship)]] instead.

title: elena_(street_fighter)
body:
A character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She first appeared in [[Street Fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]] and is voiced by Fujino Hotaru in New Generation and [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|2nd Impact]], Midori Mie in [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|3rd Strike]], and [[Fujita Saki]] in [[Street Fighter X Tekken]]. She is currently the [[tall female|second tallest female character in the series, standing at 183 cm]], she has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and wears a [[white bikini]].

Elena is a tribal princess from [[Kenya]] who have decided to study aboard to learn more about the world and people. Her extroverted, cheerful, and oftentimes naive personality often backfires her attempt to befriending others. She uses [[capoeira]] as her fighting style.
other_names: エレナ(ストリートファイター)

title: fairy_tone
body:
Eight gem-like fairies used by the [[suite_precure|Suite PreCure]] heroines to either transform or perform special attacks. Seven can be summoned by [[hummy_(suite_precure)|Hummy]], while the eighth one accompanies [[cure_muse_(yellow)|Cure Muse]]. Each of the Fairy Tone's names (excluding [[crescendo_tone|Crescendo Tone]]) are based on the Solfège scale (Do, Re, Mi, Fa, So, La, Ti).

* [[dory|Dory]] (ドリー) - Pink in color. Allows [[houjou_hibiki|Hibiki]] to transform into [[Cure Melody]]. When played in a Cure Module, it allows its user to have sweet dreams.
* [[rery|Rery]] (レリー) - White in color. Allows [[minamino_kanade|Kanade]] to transform into [[Cure Rhythm]]. When played in a Cure Module, it renews its user's willpower.
* [[miry|Miry]] (ミリー) - Orange in color. Allows [[cure_melody|Cure Melody]] to summon her Miracle Belltier.
* [[fary|Fary]] (ファリー) - Yellow in color. Allows [[cure_rhythm|Cure Rhythm]] to summon her Fantastic Belltier.
* [[sory|Sory]] (ソリー) - Green in color. Allows [[cure_beat|Cure Beat]] to summon her Love Guitar Rod. When played in a Cure Module, it powers up the Pretty Cures.
* [[lary|Lary]] (ラリー) - Aqua in color. Allows [[Seiren (suite precure)|]]/[[Kurokawa Eren|Eren]] to transform into [[Cure Beat]].
* [[tiry|Tiry]] (シリー) - Blue in color. Only allow [[Cure Muse_(yellow)|]] to attack, but no weapon usable.
* [[dodory|Dodory]] (ドドリー) - Purple in color. Allows [[shirabe_ako|Ako]] to transform into [[cure_muse_(yellow)|Cure Muse]]. Its origin is still unknown.
* [[crescendo_tone|Crescendo Tone]] (クレッシェンドトーン) - A large gold "Fairy of Sounds" responsible for creating all sounds in the world and the other Fairy Tones, who resides in the mystical Healing Chest.

h4. See also

* Wikia: http://prettycure.wikia.com/wiki/Fairy_Tones
* AniDB: http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=character&charid=29255

title: brush_holder
body:
A brush holder is a traditional tool used in calligraphy to hold brushes when they are not in use. It is typically designed to keep the brush upright, preserving its bristles and preventing damage. Brush holders come in various shapes, materials, and designs, depending on the culture and era they are from.

In Japan they may be called "fude kake", whereas in China they may be called "bi gua". These terms loosely translate to "hanging brush", as these holders have the brush suspended upside-down.

title: beretta_92
body:
A series of 9×19mm [b][[handgun]][/b] designed and manufactured by Fabbrica d'Armi Pietro Beretta of Brescia, Italy in 1975. It can be recognized by the large slide cutout exposing much of the barrel and the slide-mounted safety/decocking lever (the original model had a frame-mounted safety). Use this tag for all Beretta 92-pattern [[weapon]]s, like the Taurus PT-92 (Brazil), ATI AT92C, PAMAS G1 (France), Beretta 96 (USA) .40 S&W version), etc.

h4. See also

title: special_air_service
body:
[quote][i]"Who Dares Wins”[/i] - Official motto[/quote]

The [[united kingdom|British]] [[military operator|special forces]] service, the most elite branch of the British Army itself known as the Regiment. Well known for the [[1980 Iranian embassy siege]], where they eliminated 5 kidnappers and rescued all but one of the hostages.

It was created during [[World War II]]. The name "Special Air Service" was meant to deceive the [[Nazi]] intelligence agencies into thinking it was a division of the [[royal air force|RAF]].

h1. See also
* [[British Army]]
* [[Royal Navy]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Special Air Service":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_Air_Service

title: fast_helmet
body:
The [b]Ops-Core Future Assault Shell Technology (FAST) Helmet[/b], also known as the [b]FAST helmet[/b] is an American tactical helmet usually worn by Elite Special Forces operators and even by Regular infantry in both Armies and Marine Corps as well as Police forces (particularly SWAT units) in different nations across the world.

The FAST helmet series is characteristic for its shell shape – ear cut geometry which extends critical coverage over the rear occipital bone without load carrier interference, and optimizes weight distribution for increased stability, integration, balance, and improved comfort.

title: jormungandr_(norse_mythology)
body: Jörmungandr also known as the Midgard Serpent or World Serpent, is an unfathomably large and monstrous sea serpent or worm who dwells in the world sea, encircling the Earth and biting its own tail, an example of an ouroboros. As a result of his surrounding Midgard, the beast is referred to as the World Serpent. Jörmungandr releasing his tail is one of the signs of the beginning of Ragnarök.

title: trinity_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] music unit consisting of [[Takamiya Rion]], [[Hakase Fuyuki]], and [[Furen E Lustario]], signed under [[NBC]][[Universal Studios|Universal]] Entertainment Japan and officially debuted as unit on 1 September 2020 when they released original song "L♡Fanfare"

Not to be confused with [[Trinity]].

title: momoko_nuihara
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' second generation. Character design by [[Buket Pudding I]]. Momoko is also part of the sub-group Celestrio along with her fellow genmates [[Hikari Kogane]] and [[Manon Merope]].

On December 9, 2024, Momoko announced her graduation on the day of NEXAS' shutdown, which is on January 31, 2025.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]], an [[ahoge]] sticking up, some [[hairclip|hairclips]], two [[x hair ornament|crossed hairclips]], a [[braid]] and [[green eyes]].

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[pink bowtie|pink]] [[striped bowtie]], a [[pink cardigan]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[beige jacket|beige]] [[blazer]] with [[notched lapels]] and a [[charm (object)|]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. Momoko holds a [[black bag|black]] [[school bag]] with [[pin|pins]].


* !asset #23285460: Profile

h4. External links

* "Twitter account":[https://twitter.com/MomokoNuihara]
* "YouTube account":[https://youtube.com/@MomokoNuihara]

title: the_flintstones
body:
An animated sitcom by [[Hanna-Barbera|Hanna-Barbera Productions]] depicting the titular family in a romanticized stone age setting that contains many primitive versions of modern conveniences such as [[car|automobiles]] and [[phone|telephones]]. [[Dinosaur|Dinosaurs]] are also commonly kept as pets like [[cat|cats]] or [[dog|dogs]].

h4. Characters

title: luetzow_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German battlecruiser SMS [i]Lützow[/i].
[tn]Not to be confused with the much later Kriegsmarine heavy cruiser [i]Lützow[/i], who was sold to the Soviets as [[Tallinn (Azur Lane)|]]. Or [[Deutschland (azur lane)|]], who were later renamed into [i]Lützow[/i] following the sale of Tallinn.[/tn]

Note: Standard convention for "ü" is to write it as "ue" when ü is unavailable or inconvenient. For usability reasons Danbooru does not use 'accented' letters in tags.

In-game, she has partially [[braid]]ed [[long hair|long]] [[platinum blonde hair]] and grayish-purple eyes. Her outfit consists of a buttoned [[white shirt]] with [[breast pocket|breast pockets]], a black [[belt]] around a [[black skirt]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[mini hat]].

Her rig is the standard Ironblood animalistic style, with her 30.5 cm twin gun mounts placed on either side.

title: maestrale_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i] (lit. Mistral) in [[Azur Lane]]. 
Character design by [[Byulzzi]], voiced by Eino Airi.

In-game, she sports [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] (mostly [[white hair|white]] with red inner hair) and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[green jacket]], [[red armband]] with the [[Sardegna Empire (emblem)|]] emblem printed on it, and a black [[beret]] and a [[black ribbon]].

Her rig consists of two 120 mm twin gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], one gun and torpedo mount on each side. The bridge superstructure is mounted to her back and connects the two sides.

title: leander_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
In [[Leander (azur lane)|]]'s [[retrofit (azur lane)|]], her black shirt is swapped for a white shirt, and her old white shirt over-layer is replaced with a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]]. Her wrist cuffs are replaced in favor of [[fingerless gloves]] that extend to just below her elbow, and have similar plaid trim to her skirt and sleeves. She gains a [[purple hairband]] and a [[purple bow]] as a bowtie. She now has anchors where the garter straps meet her thighhighs.

Her rigging maintains a mostly similar design, with the half hulls being more emptied out and thin, extending off of mechanical arms, as opposed to directly attached to the back.

h4. Appearance

title: leander_(azur_lane)
body:
Lead ship of the Royal Navy Leander-class light cruisers, HMS [i]Leander[/i], [[Azur Lane]].

Leander has [[blue eyes]] and [[platinum blonde hair|platinum blonde]] [[long hair]]. She wears a [[black_shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] with an open [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] on top, and a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[high-waist skirt]]. Her waistband and shirt cuffs have [[plaid trim]], and a [[white ribbon]] with miniature [[anchor|anchors]] is tied under her shirt collar. She has [[wrist cuffs]] that are extended where the button binds. Below the waist, she has [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split hull design with 4 twin-[[ship turret|turrets]] and 2 quad-[[torpedo tubes]]. Two of her turrets are mounted directly onto the hulls, with the third being attached via a mechanical arm and the fourth being handheld. On her back is a [[smokestack]].

h4. Skins

title: goose
body:
A large waterfowl in the Anatidae family.

A gander is a male goose. Young birds are called goslings. A group of geese on the ground is a gaggle; when in flight, they are called a skein, team, or wedge; when flying close together, they are called a plump.

Geese are larger than [[duck]]s and smaller than most [[swan]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Canada Goose]]
* [[Greater White-fronted Goose]]
* [[Duck]]
* [[Swan]]
* [[Untitled Goose Game]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: langley_(azur_lane)
body:
First Eagle Union (light) carrier, USS [i]Langley[/i] (CV-1), in [[Azur Lane]].

h5. Base Art

Langley has [[long hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]], mint-[[green hair]] with a [[single side bun]] on her left side and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a [[dress shirt]], a [[blue bow|blue]] [[bowtie]], a yellow [[vest]], a black [[pencil skirt]], and [[black pantyhose]]. She has a [[lab coat]] with an [[American flag print]] lining the inside, [[star print|stars]] on her right and [[striped|stripes]] on her left. She has [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]] with a [[rudder_footwear|rudder heel]]. She also wears oval [[glasses]] and wields a [[riding crop]].

Her [[rigging]] is her ship model split into her bow on her left, and her stern on her right. The hulls are painted white, and each have a brown [[flight deck]] with white markings.

h5. Retrofit Art

After her [[retrofit (azur lane)|retrofit]], she swaps out the dress shirt and vest combo for a [[sleeveless]] dress shirt with [[cleavage_cutout|cleavage]] and [[navel_cutout|navel cutouts]]. She also swaps the labcoat for a shoulderless [[black coat]] with alternating strips of starts and stripes. Her glasses are now rectangular as opposed to oval.

Her rigging now adopts a steel grey and black colorscheme. A notable difference is the bow-half is missing part of it's flight deck, a nod to her real life refit to a sea plane tender. Another difference is the bow and stern sections switched sides, with the bow on her right, and stern on her left.

In game, Langley is a teacher, often scolding the commander and bemoaning being treated like child due to her small stature (a nod to how small the ship was). Both her personality and her skill "First-Generation Carrier," which boosts carrier exp gain, are likely a nod to her role as the first USN carrier, allowing for early training of pilots.

Her plane loadout is entirely fighters, allowing her an incredible amount of air control/anti-plane ability for her rarity/oil cost.

h4. Skins
* !post #2947250: Default
* !post #2947253: [[langley_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)|Retrofit]]

title: wb_102
body:
Where the Federation Space Force is concerned, all mobile suits are marked according to their mothership. Katoki (and the Master Archive book) uses two-letter abbreviations, such as "WB" for White Base, "AL" for Albion, "MR" for Mariana, etc. The recent MSV-R series tends to use hull numbers instead - SBB-17 for the GM Cannons stationed aboard the Luzal, SVC-71 for the GM Intercept Customs assigned to the White Base II - but it's the same concept. That's a small enough group that they only need a couple of numbers to tell the mobile suits apart, and when they're using three digits, the first one is typically the team number and the second is normally zero.

Thus, Katoki's interpretation of the [b]RX-78 Gundam is marked "WB 102"[/b] because it's the second machine of the White Base's one and only mobile suit team. The machines of South Burning's "Immortal 4th Team" are labeled "LV 401" through "LV 404", which might mean their mothership carries multiple teams, or perhaps that it operates as part of a larger squadron where they need to be able to distinguish the teams...

title: ellie_sattler_(jurassic_park)
body: Dr. Ellie Sattler is a fictional character in the [[Jurassic Park]] franchise. She is introduced in Michael Crichton's 1990 novel Jurassic Park, which began the franchise. [[Steven Spielberg]] directed the 1993 film adaptation, casting Laura Dern as Sattler and giving the character a more substantial role compared to the novel. She is a paleobotanist in both the novel and its film adaptation. In the novel, she is a student of Dr. [[Alan Grant]]. For the film, Spielberg made them a romantic couple, with Sam Neill portraying Grant.

title: lamia
body:
A [[monster girl]] whose upper body is human and whose lower body is [[snake]]-like. Lamia and naga are often rendered so similarly as to make it merely a matter of style which one a serpent-legged character will be called.

The term "naga":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nāga comes from Hinduism and Buddhism, and literally means "cobra". Naga can appear with varying degrees of humanity, but typically have fully human torsos. The term "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia comes from Greek, though its original usage did not possess snake-like qualities. It was only in the 1600s that "Robert Burton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Burton_(scholar) ascribed the familiar qualities, which were subsequently popularized by "John Keats":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Keats in his poem "lamia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamia_(poem), published in July 1820.

The Japanese, apparently not having either of these myths as a major part of their tradition, tend to ascribe lamia/naga with personalities like those they associate with snakes in general and lamia are often the tsundere types.

h4. Notable Lamias

* !post #7278069: [[Alipheese Fateburn XVI]] from [i][[Mon-Musu Quest!]][/i]
* !post #6563514: [[Cassiopeia (league Of Legends)|]] from [i][[League of Legends]][/i]
* !post #98488: [[Deis]] from [i][[Breath of Fire]][/i]
* !post #2795203: [[Echidna (Granblue Fantasy)|]] from [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i]
* !post #2258939: [[Echidna (P&D)|]] from [i][[Puzzle & Dragons]][/i]
* !post #7051802: [[Jashin-chan]] from [i][[Jashin-chan Dropkick]][/i]
* !post #2376255: [[Kiyohime (fate)|Kiyohime]] from [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i]
* !post #620989: [[Lamia Hygieia]] from [i][[Mamonomusume to no Seikatsu]][/i]
* !post #5298315: [[Miia (Monster Musume)|]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]][/i]
* !post #4020458: [[Saphentite Neikes]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Oisha-san]][/i]

h4. See also

title: iriam
body:
A company that hosts a livestreaming platform of the same name, made specifically for [[virtual YouTuber]]s, referred to as 'virtual livers' when they're on the platform.

IRIAM also has a large number of official VTubers in addition to those from other origins.

They later created [[i-Live]], a production that manages their official livers.

IRIAM launched an English version on November 15, 2024 as a United States-only beta release, and there are plans to expand to other countries.

title: sage_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. The Sage has the combined magical abilities of the [[Priest (dq3)|]] and [[Mage (dq3)|]], and is the only class that cannot be used at the start of the game. The only way to get a Sage is to change one of the other classes into one at the Alltrades Abbey found partway through the game. Most classes need Words of Enlightment to become a Sage, but the otherwise useless [[Gadabout (dq3)|]] can become a Sage without one.

The female Sage wears a short white dress and a blue cape, while the male wears a sleeveless blue robe. Both versions carry a wooden staff and wear a circlet, and have long blue hair. However, in the HD-2D remake of III, players can now customize the appearance of characters like the Sage.

h4. Official art
* !post #8485358
* !post #8467140

For the [[Dragon Quest II]] character, see [[Sidoh]].

[spoiler]He is, in fact, the reincarnation of the Dragon Quest II character. However, his bonds with the Builder allowed him to transcend his fate of becoming once more the God of Destruction.[/spoiler]

title: female_builder_(dqb2)
body:
The female main character of [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]] with a love of building structures and systems. She is popularly referred to as [b]Crea[/b] or [b]Kurie[/b] by fans. Additionally, some English-speaking fans refer to her as [b]Creatrix[/b] due to photos from the game tutorials using that name for her.

While the player is able to customize the main character, the Female Builder is typically portrayed with [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and with [[red ribbon]]s in her hair.

According to pre-release material, she is the descendant of either the [[male builder (dqb)|male]] or [[female builder (dqb)|female]] player character from [i][[Dragon Quest Builders]][/i].

h4. Official art
* !post #8644228

title: male_builder_(dqb2)
body:
The male co-protagonist of [[Dragon Quest Builders 2]]. He is popularly referred to by fans as [b]Birudo[/b] or [b]Buildrick[/b]. While his default design has [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], the game's customization features enable players to change these aspects alongside hairstyles and clothing. According to pre-release material, he is the descendant of either the [[male builder (dqb)|male]] or [[female builder (dqb)|female]] player character from [i][[Dragon Quest Builders]][/i].

title: jessica_albert
body:
One of the protagonists of [i][[Dragon Quest VIII]][/i] and the game's only playable female character, Jessica is a noblewoman who joins the party to avenge her brother [[Alistair Albert|Alistair's]] murder.  At first she is lacking in social niceties, coming off as bossy and pushy, but she eventually softens and becomes one of the [[Hero (dq8)|]]'s most important friends.

She is well-known for wearing a low-cut [[off-shoulder shirt]] that highlights her [[large breasts]], and even uses her sex appeal in combat to distract enemies.

Jessica also appears in [[Itadaki Street]], a [[Monopoly]]-style game for the [[Wii]] featuring characters from the [i]Dragon Quest[/i] and [i][[Mario (series)|]][/i] series.

h4. Official art

title: lingsha_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. 

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission following the Ambrosial Arbor Crisis. Voiced by [[Maeda Kaori]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[colored extremities|red-colored skin]] on the arms and legs, and [[medium breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] black [[crop top]] held by a white [[criss-cross halter]], white [[wrist cuffs]], [[black skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8651700: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
"I am a Vidyadhara, born and raised on the Luofu, and I once studied the healing arts under the name of 'Dan Zhu.' But my master became bogged down in politics and was banished to a place far from home. I followed her there. Now that I've changed my name and come home, many complicated feelings have returned."

The new Cauldron Master of the Xianzhou Luofu's Alchemy Commission. An intelligent and quick-witted Vidyadhara healer. She has a sharp sense of smell and often uses this to diagnose illnesses, as well as utilizing incense to calm the minds of others.

She is adept at dealing with complicated social relationships. Though she might be fuming inside, her expression would remain calm and serene.
[/expand]

h4. See also

* [[Nuwa (Honkai Impact)|]] - Her [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.
* [[Fuyuan (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - Her "incense beast" companion.

title: manny_pacquiao
body:
Also known as "PacMan", he is a Filipino boxer, businessman, politician, actor, and singer. 

In boxing, he is the only eight-division world champion in its history and has won twelve major world titles. He was also the first boxer to win the lineal championship in four different weight classes, the first boxer to win major world titles in four of the eight "glamour divisions" (flyweight, featherweight, lightweight, and welterweight), and is the only boxer to hold world championships across four decades (1990s, 2000s, 2010s, and 2020s).

title: rear_naked_choke
body:
The rear naked choke (RNC) is a [[choke hold]] in martial arts applied from an opponent's back, which has an optional use of body scissors to further restrain the opponent's movement.

In professional wrestling, the term "rear naked choke" refers to a grounded version of the [[sleeper hold]] with body scissors applied. This variant is used by several wrestlers such as [[All Elite Wrestling]] and [i]Ring of Honor[/i] wrestler [[Samoa Joe]] (calling his RNC as the [i]Coquina Clutch[/i]), [[WWE]] wrestlers [[Gunther (WWE)|]] (as the [i]Gojira Clutch[/i]), and Shayna Baszler (as the [i]Kirifuda Clutch[/i]). WWE wrestler Karrion Kross does a modified version of the RNC which he calls as the [i]Kross Jacket[/i].  

In [[Judo]], the rear naked choke is known as Hadaka-jime, one of the 36 constriction techniques of Kodokan Judo

title: otoshidama
body:
A [[gift]] of [[money]] given to children on Japanese [[New Year]]'s Day.

Otoshidama tend to be given in white [[envelope]]s bound with a pink or red paper 'ribbon cord' (in [i]mizuhiki[/i] style). Often this "ribbon cord" may just be a pattern printed on the envelope. Money bills are usually folded in threes before being inserted.

The word "お年玉" (otoshidama) may sometimes be printed on the front of the envelope. This unambiguously identifies this as otoshidama (instead of [[hongbao]]). A less common word is "祝".

h4. Examples

* !post #1595291
* !post #1891823
* !post #2983502
* !post #3218197

h4. See also

* [[New Year]]
* [[hongbao]] [tn]Chinese equivalent. Often red. Almost never white (considered inauspicious).[/tn]

It consists of a [[white kimono|white]] [[fur-trimmed kimono]] with a [[side slit]] and [[frilled kimono|red frills]] and [[gold trim]], [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]].

title: oak_cake_roll_(honkai:_star_rail)
body: A consumable in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. In-setting, the food item originated from a nutritional desperation among frontier settlers before evolving into a culinary tradition among the aristocratic classes. As such, the name is literal— elements from actual oak trees and other flora are baked into the cakes, presenting a formidable challenge for diners who order them. Usually associated with [[Firefly (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], who gets one every day in Penacony.

title: navy_seals
body:
The [b]United States Navy Sea, Air, and Land (SEAL) Teams[/b], also known as the [b]Navy Seals[/b], is the [[military operator|Special Forces]] of the [[United States Navy]]. 

Since its founding in January 1, 1962, the Navy SEALs have performed various special military operations for the United States military throughout the world.

The group became famous when one of it's Teams, [b]Naval Special Warfare Development Group[/b] (DEVGRU), unofficially known as [b]Seal Team 6[/b], the most elite force of the Navy SEALs, killed Al-Qaeda leader [[Osama bin Laden]] on May 2, 2011.

Unfortunately, due to the Seals new found fame, some former and current members have criticize some of their teammates, especially newer ones, of becoming rude and disrespectful to the chain of command, who are more interested of becoming famous rather than doing their duty and serving their country.

title: exia_repair
body:
[b]GN-001RE Gundam Exia Repair[/b]
A crudely fixed [[Gundam Exia]], kept in bare working order by [[setsuna f. seiei|Setsuna F. Seiei]] after the battles against [[Alejandro Corner]] and [[Graham Aker]]. Its left arm is missing, that part of the MS covered with a cloth, and the right side of its head is a makeshift graft from a Tieren, which gives it a right eye glowing red. Moreover, the right knee armor is gone, as is the left waist armor plate, and the GN Sword on its right arm is [[damaged|broken]], with only half of it stil there.

title: homelander
body: [b]Homelander[/b] (real name [b]John Gillman[/b]) is the main antagonist of the comic book series [[The Boys]], and one of the two posthumous overarching antagonists (alongside [[Black Noir]]) of it's sequel/spin-off miniseries The Boys: Dear Becky. He is also the leader of The Seven, one of the strongest Supes in the world, and the archenemy of [[Billy Butcher]], the leader of The Boys. He is essentially a psychopathic [[parody]] of [[Superman]]. He is also notorious for his tendency to spam his [[laser]] [[eye beam]] attacks. h4. See also * [[Omni-Man]] - similar hero-villain character * [[Homelander Power Scaling (meme)]] * [[Yummers (meme)]]

title: homelander_power_scaling_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] which originated from a 2024 Twitter debate about whether [[Homelander]] from [[The Boys]] or [[Sportacus]] from [[LazyTown]] was stronger.

After many pointed out that Sportacus was capable of numerous superhuman feats that far surpassed Homelander, the meme later evolved into a powerscaling fanart trend that involves pitting Homelander against Sportacus or other characters in a typically one-sided fight.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/homelander-vs-sportacus

title: leatherclub_scene_(meme)
body:
One of the most famous scenes in the [[Gachimuchi]] universe, which originally came from gay porn series "Lords of the Lockeroom" (the origin of the Gachimuchi universe).

In this scene, [[Van Darkholme]] walked into the [[locker room]] to change his outfit from his [[BDSM|leather]] outfit to exercise. [[Mark Wolff]], who was sitting on a [[bench]], mocked Van's leather outfit by saying "Hey buddy, I think you got the wrong door, the Leather club is two blocks down". Van  instantly replied "Fuck you", prompting Wolff to challenge Van to do gay pants wrestling and Van accepted his challenge.

title: orc_eiyuu_monogatari
body:
Orc Eiyūden Monogatari ~Sontaku Retsuden~ (Orc Hero Story ~Biographical Conjecture~) is a 2019-to-present light novel series by Rifujin na Magonote (author of [[Mushoku Tensei]]).  The series began physical publication in 2020 and features illustrations by [[Asanagi]].  A manga adaption is in the works and the novels are published as Orc Eroica in English.

The series revolves around the [[orc]] hero [[Bash_(orc_eiyuu_monogatari)|]] who has set off on a journey as a representative of his race after the end of the great war between the 12 races. While being a representative of his race is the surface reason for Bash's journey, he has the ulterior motive of using this journey as a means to lose his virginity.

h5. List of Characters

title: card_game
body:
A game played with [[card]]s as the main medium of interaction.

Card games were typically divided in two categories:

* [b]Collectible card game[/b] (CCG), a card game that utilize a fixed set of cards with little to no new cards added into the game, such as the classic [[playing card]]s and [[UNO (game)|]].
* [b]Trading card game [/b] (TCG), derived from [[trading card]]s, a card game that feature a wide variety of cards, with new cards being regularily added into the game. Notable examples including [[Magic: The Gathering]] and [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]
other_names: トレーディングカードゲーム

title: m.u.g.e.n
body:
A "[[Fighting game]] engine" made by Elecbyte originally intended to be made into a run-and-gun game. When it was abandoned in 1999, modders turned it into an open-source fighting game with official fighting game characters and fanmade versions of many different characters.

Surprisingly, two characters were produced for M.U.G.E.N before its discontinuation: [[Kung Fu Man]] and [[Suave Dude]]. Both of these two characters became the base of the modders to create various new characters. 

After learning about their abandoned project being revived, Elecbyte briefly returned in September of 2009 with a new HD version of MUGEN available for download on its site.

This tag can be applied to various [[original]] M.U.G.E.N characters, either a completely original design or an [[alternate costume]] of an existing character.

title: 2024_south_korea_martial_law_crisis
body:
On the night of 3 December, 2024, [[South Korea]]n president [[Yoon Suk-Yeol]] declared martial law to suspend the country's parliament. In his declaration, Yoon accused the opposition coalition, which has the majority in the National Assembly, of being involved in "anti-state activities".

In the ensuing events, the opposition coalition MPs voted to force the president to lift the martial law, and protests ensued to pressure Yoon to lift the martial law. After just 6 hours, president Yoon lifted the martial law after pressure from the South Korean public.

The event was generally described as a self-coup, as Yoon's approval ratings had significantly dropped before the event, along with facing various scandals. Yoon was later impeached on 14 December that year.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 2024 South Korean martial law crisis":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_South_Korean_martial_law_crisis]

body:

title: ze_(phrase)
body:
ぜ

A particle in the Japanese language which adds emphasis and masculinity to a sentence.

It is frequently associated with [[Kirisame Marisa]], who commonly ends her sentences with ze, even when it doesn't make much grammatical sense.

This tag should [b]not[/b] be used any time the ze particle appears in a sentence. It should only be used when it is given some form of emphasis, such as when a speech bubble contains nothing but the word ze, or the word is written in romaji in the original text.

This tag replaces pool #1431: Touhou - Kirisame Marisa - ZE!

title: ford_crown_victoria
body: A full-sized sedan manufactured by the [[Ford|Ford Motor Company]], the Crown Victoria was best known as the iconic [[police car]] (and [[taxi]]) for several decades. Built on Ford's Panther platform, shared with the [[Lincoln Town Car]] and Mercury Grand Marquis. Production of the entire line completely ceased in 2012 (with the Crown Victoria Police Interceptor having already been discontinued in 2011). Cars that replaced the Crown Vic in police fleets vary by city, some common replacements being the [[Dodge Charger]], [[Ford Taurus]], and [[Chevrolet Caprice]]. h4. Generations * !post #5204069: [[ford crown victoria (1st generation)|1st Generation]] (1991-1997) * !post #5093657: [[ford crown victoria (2nd generation)|2nd Generation]] (1998-2012)

title: sengoku_jidai
body:
A period of feudal [[Japan]] between around circa 1450 to 1600 in which the country was divided among various clans of warlords who fought for dominance over the others, following the decline of the Ashikaga Shogunate at the end of the [[Nanboku-chou Jidai]].

The period reached its climax around 1540 when the "three great unifiers" of Japan emerged; [[Oda Nobunaga]] who managed to unify Japan by force before being forced to commit suicide after being betrayed by [[Akechi Mitsuhide]], [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]], Nobunaga's retainer who revenged his master by killing Mitsuhide and unify Japan, before faced his downfall after a failed invasion of Korea in 1598, and [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]], another of the Nobunaga's retainer who waited for an opportunity and seized all of remnants of Toyotomi and Oda clans and finally unified the country after the [[battle of Sekigahara]]. 

The era ended with Japan being united under the leadership of the Tokugawa shogunate who closed the country and started the [[Edo Jidai|Edo period]]. Due to being one of the most prevalent era in Japanese history, several media franchises have emerged based on it. It also has influenced various media works in the country.

h4. See also

* [[Samurai]]

title: alternate_headwear_color

title: fk_crvena_zvezda
body:
[B]Fudbalski klub Crvena zvezda[/b] (Football Club Red Star), otherwise colloqually referred to internationally as Red Star Belgrade, is a Serbian professional football club based in Belgrade, and a member of the Red Star multi-sport club. It is the most successful club from Southeastern Europe, and the most popular football club in Serbia. Their eternal rivals are fellow Belgrade football club Partizan, engaged in one of Europe's fiercest derbies.

In Japan, the club is well-known for winning the 1991 Intercontinental Cup, whose final match was played in Tokyo (which in Serbia prompted the slogan 'Srbija do Tokija' [Serbia to Tokyo], due to winning the European Cup that year in Italy as well); its most well-known member in Japan is [[Dragan Stojkovic Piksi|Dragan Stojković "Piksi"]], who signed with [[Nagoya Grampus]] and would later coach for the team after retirement.

h4. External links

* Twitter: "FKツルヴェナ ズヴェズダ":https://twitter.com/crvenazvezda_jp
other_names: レッドスター・ベオグラード

title: guy_(final_fight)
body:
[b]Guy[/b] is a video game character in both the [[Final Fight]] and [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. 

He first appeared in the 1989 beat 'em up Final Fight and later appeared in the [i]Street Fighter Alpha[/i] series. 

Guy is a red-clad ninpō master of Japanese descent who has been taught the special Bushin form of [[ninjutsu]].

According to Capcom's original arcade production staff, Guy's original design was based on "Guy Picciotto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guy_Picciotto , the former vocalist of the late 80s post-hardcore punk rock band "Fugazi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fugazi . Like his video game counterpart, Picciotto was known for his fondness to wear orange shirts and [[converse]] sneaker shoes during concerts.

h4. See also

* [[Genryuusai Maki]]

title: chinese_zodiac
body:
The Shēngxiào (Chinese: 生肖), better known in English as the Chinese Zodiac, is a scheme that relates each year to an animal and its reputed attributes, which, combined with the 5 Chinese elements (fire, water, earth, wood, metal), creates a 60-year cycle. 

Unlike the Western [[zodiac]], it has no relation to the constellations on the ecliptic.

Many other Asian countries have adopted the Chinese Zodiac as well, sometimes with slight changes ("see below":#dtext-variants).

This tag is automatically applied when the image reference at least one of the Chinese Zodiac, such as various [[New Year]] arts.

A [[kyuubi|nine-tailed]] [[fox_girl|kitsune]], Kaga has [[white hair]] and [[multiple tails|tails]], [[blue eyes]] with red [[eyeshadow]], and [[large breasts]]. She is often wearing a [[fox mask]] as well. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[black kimono]], [[white coat|white]] [[haori]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[hakama skirt]], [[black corset]] with a [[sakuramon]], black [[wristband]]s, [[grey collar]] with a sakuramon, [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear]]. title: belial_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]].

The fallen angel of cunning plays fast and loose with his tongue, condemning the world at one moment, extolling the sanctity of life the next. Watch him run his fingers down the supple stem of a flower, snap it in twain, and waltz across a stage garnished with skydwellers' viscera. Look into the abyss of his heart, and what does one find? A feeling of insecure narcissism, or is it altruistic benevolence? Belial numbered among the first primal beasts to be brought into existence. Now a fallen angel known as the Serpent, he remains as devoted to his creator, [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], as he was millennia ago. [spoiler]  He instigated the Primarch rebellions as part of Lucilius' schemes. "000" reveals that his loyalties have carried over 2000 years, having used [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]]'s body to revive Lucilius to help the Astral finally witness the end of the world. [/spoiler]

Belial was revealed as a Character Pass Season 1 DLC character in [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]] on December 14, 2019, as part of a villains pack alongside Beelzebub. He was later carried over to [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]], along with the other prior DLC characters.

h4.Official Alternate Costumes

title: lucio_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]].

The beautiful young man, surrounded by a divine aura, introduced himself as a "former stage actor" when he appeared before the crew. He is very gentle and dislikes conflicts. However, since he does not understand the subtleties of other people's emotions very well, his heart grieves at the sight of people fighting, especially if it's because of his beautiful face. He has profound knowledge about the bottom of the sky - another world called the "Crimson Horizon". [spoiler]He is the true identity of [[helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)|Helel ben Sahar]].[/spoiler]

h4. Profile

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Age[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Race[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hobbies[/td][td]People-watching[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Likes[/td][td]Pure, righteous, and beautiful people; good deeds[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dislikes[/td][td]Snakes, evil people, apples[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4. Official Alternate Costumes
Shares a striking resemblance with the supreme primarch [[lucifer_(Shingeki no Bahamut)|Lucifer]] and the Astral researcher [[Lucilius_(Granblue Fantasy)|Lucilius]]. To avoid any mistaken tagging, you can rely on the following contextual cues: Lucifer is frequently paired with [[Sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and features [six pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/1/1e/Npc_zoom_3990190000_01.png), while Lucio, often seen in his [summer outfit](https://gbf.wiki/images/9/9e/Npc_zoom_3040286000_01.png), has [two pairs of wings](https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3040106000_01.png). Lucilius is typically depicted wearing either his [https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002](astral robes) or his [https://gbf.wiki/images/d/d6/Npc_zoom_3991054000_01.png](Raid Boss) attire.

* !post #7392267: Default
* !post #3869877: [[lucio (summer) (granblue fantasy)|Summer]]

title: lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:
[[Shingeki no Bahamut]] and [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese.

One of the very first primal beasts ever created, he is known as the supreme primarch who commands all other archangels. He was made to oversee evolution by an [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Astral researcher]] who had a keen interest in the subject. Bequeathed with ultimate power by the Astrals, he strives to protect the people of the Sky Realm. Even now, his eyes—melancholic and unsuited to an ultimate weapon—scan the blue horizon, in search of anything that might disturb the progress of the skies. Originally just a Shingeki no Bahamut collaboration summon, he becomes an important recurring character in the "What Makes the Sky Blue" storyline.

[spoilers]Lucifer is credited as the creator of the archangels [[sandalphon_(granblue_fantasy)|Sandalphon]] and [[raziel_(granblue_fantasy)|Raziel]]. He and [[belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]] were Lucilius' first creations and were created at the same time. In What Makes the Sky Blue II: Paradise Lost, he is decapitated by [[beelzebub_(granblue_fantasy)|Beelzebub]] so that he and Belial can harvest his body and use it to resurrect Lucillius. Overwhelmed with grief and anger, Sandalphon initially struggles with the loss but ultimately resolves to honor Lucifer's legacy. Sandalphon ascends to become the new supreme primarch, taking on the responsibilities and burden of leadership to protect the skies as Lucifer once did.[/spoilers]

Lucifer shares a similar appearance with Lucilius and is identical to [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] in both face and clothing, making differentiation challenging. Lucifer wears a short-sleeved [[breastplate]] with [[shoulder armor]], [[elbow gloves]], a thin red cloth around his neck, and a [[white cape]]. Unlike Lucio, who has two small wings, Lucifer has [[multiple_wings|six]] large [[feathered_wings|feathered]] [[white wings]]. Without wings, their personalities offer clues: Lucio appears teasing, while Lucifer is more innocent and joyous. Sandalphon is often annoyed by Lucio but blushes or appears delighted around Lucifer. Most [[yaoi|ship art]] featuring Sandalphon pairs him with Lucifer unless explicitly indicated otherwise.

title: top_gear
body:
A [[BBC (broadcaster)|]] motoring show that became famous not only in Britain but also internationally and includes discussions, races, interviews, car challenges and a variety of other segments. Its most famous period and the inspiration for most works on this site referencing the series are when  [[Jeremy Clarkson]], [[James May]] and [[Richard Hammond]] presented a reworked version of the show from Series 1 in 2002 to Series 22 in 2015. Another well known character from [i]Top Gear[/i] is the  [[The Stig]], played by a number of anonymous race drivers.

The show was briefly cancelled in 2015 after Jeremy Clarkson was fired from the BBC for punching a producer, with Hammond and May leaving soon after. However, due to its popularity, they would be hired by [[Amazon (company)|]] for a new show called [[The Grand Tour]], which followed the same format.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article: Top Gear (2002 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top_Gear_(2002_TV_series)]

title: lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character. Voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese and [[Sean Chiplock]] in English.

Introduced as ??? in the first part of the event "What Makes the Sky Blue", Lucilius is later revealed in the second part to be an Astral and the creator of the first Primal Beasts, Supreme Primarch Lucifer and his adjutant [[Belial_(granblue_fantasy)|Belial]]. 

This Astral was the head researcher of a research lab. His unequivocal genius and transcendent will led to many breakthroughs that would shake up the world—notably the birth of the original primal beasts. But as his research into evolution progressed, he drew his own conclusions about the gods' designs and established the fallen angels to bring about his grand finale—a plan intended to destroy the world. Though rarely moved by emotion, he harbors a centuries-old hatred for the gods, seeing them as tyrants who imposed order on the boundless universe. For him, there is only one state of true freedom—nothingness.

On December 2, 2023, he was revealed as a boss in the story mode of [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]] and later joined the playable roster as the first DLC character on January 16, 2024. Later, it was announced on January 11, 2024 that he would appear as an optional post-game boss in [[Granblue Fantasy Relink]], debuting in the game on March 14, 2024.

h4. Profile

[table]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]Age[/td][td]Unknown[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Height[/td][td]175 cm[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Race[/td][td]Astral[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Hobbies[/td][td]Research[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Likes[/td][td]Free will[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dislikes[/td][td]Summer[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4.Official Alternate Costumes
In Granblue Fantasy, Lucilius, [[lucifer_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|Lucifer]], and [[lucio_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucio]] share identical facial features, making them distinguishable only by clothing and context. Lucilius, in his "Raid Boss":https://gbf.wiki/Lucilius_(NPC) form, is characterized by a [[stitched_neck|stitched neck scar]], black metallic curves on his chest and waist, [[topless_male|no shirt]], a [[torn_cape|torn]] [[red cape]], [[asymmetrical arms]], and [[armored_boots|armored]] [[thigh boots]]. In his "Astral Researcher":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/8/87/Astral_Researcher.png/revision/latest?cb=20190629090002 form, he wears an [[oversized_clothes|oversized]] [[white robe]] with a [[hood]], a [[turtleneck]], and occasionally carries a [[holding_staff|staff]]. He typically has a [[expressionless|cold expression]] and is frequently seen with Belial.

* !post #7396494: {{lucilius_(granblue_fantasy) scar|Wings of the Apocalypse}} 
* !post #8526683: {{lucilius_(granblue_fantasy) hood|Astral Researcher}}

title: blend_s

title: mega_man_(series)
body:
A series of video games by [[Capcom]] that spawned multiple game sequels, series and spin offs. Known in Japan as Rockman (ロックマン).

h4. Games
h6. Main Series

* [[Mega Man (classic)]]
* [[Mega Man X (series)|]]
* [[Mega Man Legends (series)|]] [tn]([i]Rockman Dash[/i] in Japan)[/tn]
* [[Mega Man Battle Network (series)|]] [tn]([i]Rockman EXE[/i] in Japan)[/tn]
* [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]]
* [[Mega Man Star Force (series)|]] [tn]([i]Shooting Star Rockman[/i] in Japan)[/tn]
* [[Mega Man ZX]] & [[Mega Man ZX Advent]]

h6. Other Games

* [[Pachislot Rockman Ability]], a pachislot Mega Man game.
* [[Rockman Online]], a cancelled MMORPG.
* [[Rockman Xover]], a mobile spinoff featuring characters from the entire franchise.

h6. Adaptations

* [[Mega Man Megamix]]
* [[Mega Man (Ruby-Spears)]], the 1994 animated series.
* [[Mega Man Battle Network (anime)]] (Mega Man NT Warrior)

h4. See also

* [[List of Mega Man characters]]
* [[Mega Man Day]]
* [[MegaMari]], a [[Touhou]] fangame heavily-inspired by the classic Mega Man games.
* [[Mighty No. 9]], a game meant as a spiritual successor by Keiji Inafune, one of the minds behind Mega Man. However, it suffered through multiple complications during development.
* [[Rokkochan (game)|]], an old [[flash]] game that pays homage to classic Mega Man.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mega Man":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mega_Man]

title: steven_spielberg
body: Steven Allan Spielberg (/ˈspiːlbɜːrɡ/; born December 18, 1946) is an American filmmaker. A major figure of the New Hollywood era and pioneer of the modern blockbuster, Spielberg is widely regarded as one of the greatest film directors of all time and is the most commercially successful director in film history. Among other accolades, he has received three Academy Awards, two BAFTA Awards, and four Golden Globe Awards as well as the AFI Life Achievement Award in 1995, the Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire in 2001, the Kennedy Center Honor in 2006, the Cecil B. DeMille Award in 2009 and the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2015. Seven of his films have been inducted into the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as "culturally, historically or aesthetically significant".
other_names: スティーヴン・スピルバーグ

title: las_leyendas
body: Leyendas is an animated horror-comedy film franchise created by Ricardo Arnaiz and produced by [[mexico|Mexican]] animation studio Ánima Estudios. It is loosely based on The Reluctant Dragon by Kenneth Grahame. It consists of seven films, a digital television series, and a mobile game. It centers on Leo San Juan, a heroic preteen boy who can communicate with ghosts and monsters; Theodora, a sassy and quirky preteen ghost girl with a know-it-all personality; Sir Andrés, an amicable but loony old knight; Alebrije, a mild-mannered mythological creature; and Finney and Morybetta, two silent calavera children.Set in the early nineteenth century, each of the films is based upon a different Mexican legend.

title: seiken_densetsu_1
body:
First game in the [[Seiken Densetsu]] RPG series, originally for the [[Game Boy]]. Released as [i]Final Fantasy Adventure[/i] in North America and [i]Mystic Quest[/i] in Europe.

Later remade for the [[Game Boy Advance]] under the title [i]Sword of Mana[/i]. The remake features distinctly different character designs.

Unlike later games in the franchise, the game features only one playable character, but certain allies (only one at a time) can join and help throughout the game.

h4. Characters

* [[Hero (sd1)|]]
* [[Amanda (sd1)|]]
* [[Shadow Knight (sd1)|]] ([[Dark Lord (sd1)|]])

title: i'm_not_gonna_sugarcoat_it_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] predominantly associated with [[fighting_game|fighting games]], where a portrait of a character is shown alongside one of their inputs for an effective attack, such as one that deals high amounts of damage while the opponent is unable to counter. The meme originated from the [[Tekken]] fandom and is associated with [[mishima_kazuya|Kazuya]].

title: pisaro_knight
body:
The [b]Pisaro Knight[/b] is a male [[Restless Armour]] that appears in [i][[Dragon Quest IV]][/i] as a member of [[Pisaro]]'s army. He wears [[green armor]], differentiating him from other Restless Armours. In the English localization of IV, he is referred to as [b]Sir Roseguardin[/b] or just [b]Roseguardin[/b]. 

In [i][[Dragon Quest Monsters 3]][/i], which takes place in an [[alternate universe]] to IV, he is referred to as [b]Percival[/b].

title: bosnia_and_herzegovina
body:
A small country in the Balkans, one of the earlier nations to break off from [[Yugoslavia]].

By the Dayton Agreement, the country is divided into three entities, two federal ones and a condominium between the two: the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (dominated by the Bosniaks and Croats), [[Republika Srpska]] (dominated by the Serbs), and the Brčko District respectively. 

h4. See also

* [[Sarajevo]]
other_names: ボスニア・ヘルツェゴビナ

title: humanization
body:
Characters that were [b]already humanoid[/b] ([[android]]s, [[furry|furries]], [[monster girl]]s, humanoid [[mecha]], [[elf|elves]], etc) being depicted as more human-like than usual.

This typically involves the reduction, if not outright removal, of non-human features such as [[body fur]], [[horns]], [[wings]], [[colored skin]] or [[pointy ears]]. With furry characters, they are often turned into humans with [[animal ears]]. 

For characters that were not already humanoid, such as [[animal]]s, [[creature]]s, and [[non-humanoid robot]]s, please use [[personification]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !post #7568620
* !post #6258031
* !post #5323932
* !post #4677025

h4. See also
* [[Animalization]]
* [[Character doll]]
* [[Foodification]]
* [[Furrification]]
* [i]Humanization[/i]
* [[Kemonomimi mode]]
* [[Mechanization]]
* [[Monsterification]]

* [[Personification]]

* [[Zombification]]

title: joko_widodo
body:
Joko Widodo is the ex-President of Indonesia, in office from 2014 to 2024. Previously he was Mayor of Surakarta from 2005 to 2012 and Governor of Jakarta from 2012 to 2014. He is the first Indonesian president not to have emerged from the country’s political elite or as an army general.

title: penis_envy
body:
A situation where one becomes envious on or feels inferior to another with a visibly larger [[penis]].

Unlike [[breast envy]], the penises do not have to be visible; just the implied reactions while looking down (such as talking about having an "inferior manhood") are enough.

h4. See also

* [[penis size difference]]
* [[small penis humiliation]]
* [[muscle envy]]
* [[penis awe]] 
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

Not to be confused with [[jealous]], which involves someone who doesn't want to share something that they have, or believed to.

title: excited
body:

title: furious
body:
An emotion of deep, unbridled fury. A character who is furious is consumed with anger and is often past rational thinking.

Distinct from [[annoyed|annoyance]] and [[angry|anger]]; a furious character is far beyond the minor to moderate levels of the emotion defined by those tags.

h4. See also

* [[annoyed]]
* [[angry]]
* [[anger vein]]
* [[frown]]
* [[glaring]]
* [[grimace]]
* [[scowl]]
* [[v-shaped eyebrows]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: angry
body:
A person who is angry. Especially evident when an [[anger vein]] is present, or when the character is [[glaring]].

Distinct from [[furious|fury]] and [[annoyed|annoyance]]; use this tag when a character is downright mad, but not quite furious and more than simply irritated.

title: hana_(tokyo_godfathers)
body:
Hana is one of the three main protagonists of Satoshi Kon's [[Tokyo Godfathers]].
Hana is a trans woman, and a former drag queen. She was raised by her foster mother "Mother", another drag queen who took her in after she grew up in foster care as an abandoned child. Hana began to work in "Mother's" drag bar as a singer, but she left after attacking a rude customer who called her an "old fart". Sometime afterward, she met with Gin and Miyuki, and they began their living in [[Tokyo (city)|]] as homeless people.

title: miyuki_(tokyo_godfathers)
body: Miyuki is one of the three main protagonists of the [[Tokyo Godfathers]] movie. She's a runaway girl with a past she can’t talk about. And although she thinks of herself as an independent woman, Hana and Gin have been taking care of her so that she can survive life on the streets.

title: suiseiseki
body:
[i]Jade Stone[/i]

The third [[Rozen Maiden]] doll, and [[Souseiseki]]'s older [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]]. She battles with her [[watering can]], which she can use to enter dreams. She is mischievous and verbally abusive, but she does seem to care for the other dolls and does not enjoy the Alice Game. Known for saying [[desu]] a lot, which has then reached its memetic status. Inspired the net characters [[Jissouseki]] and [[Eigyouseki]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] in [[twin drills]] and [[red eyes|red]]-[[green eyes|green]] [[heterochromia]]. Her [[lolita fashion|outfit]] consists of a [[white headscarf]] with [[lace]], a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[long dress|long]] [[green dress]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled]] [[collared dress|collar]] tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[long sleeves]], a [[black corset]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black ]] [[shoes]].

title: kylar_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aggressive and obnoxious school athlete who enjoys takes great pride in playing on the school's [[lacrosse]] team. Kylar is depicted as a stereotypical jock who is rather unintelligent and prone to violence. In some routes, he displays cases of extremism.

title: jeffrey_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

He is depicted as a socially awkward [[otaku]] and geek, who passionately shares his perverted interests to the female students, much to their discomfort. His interests and personality makes him a constant target for [[bullying]], especially from [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] and [[Kylar (class of 09)|Kylar]].

body:

The game will be discontinued at 15:00 on February 27, 2025.

title: megan_(class_of_09)
body:
A character in [[class of 09|Class of '09]] and its sequels. 

An aspiring actress and honor roll student, Megan's passion and strive for high marks has encouraged her to view herself as superior to her peers. She's known for her arrogance and bossiness, this is depicted in one route where [[Nicole (class of 09)|Nicole]] uses Megan's pride of being in a relationship against her in one route.

In general at-least three of the following should be present:

title: blood_elf_(warcraft)
body:
A race of [[elf|elves]] from the [[Warcraft]] series.  Their notably feature is their [[glowing eyes]] that are usually [[green_eyes|green]] due to their exposure to fel energy and their very long eyebrows.  Similar to other elves from Warcraft their [[pointy ears]] are [[long_pointy_ears|very long]].

They frequently are depicted wearing clothing and armor with the color scheme of red with gold.

They're a derivative of the original Warcraft High Elves, but have turned to Fel energy upon the destruction of the High Elves' Sunwell from which they originally drew their energy upon.

title: hanyuu_mayuri
body:

She cosplays as [[Lustalotte (2.5 Jigen no Ririsa)|]].

title: samwise_gamgee
body: Samwise Gamgee (/ˈsæmˌwaɪz ˈɡæmˌdʒiː/, usually called Sam) is a fictional character in J. R. R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. A hobbit, Samwise is the chief supporting character of [[The Lord of the Rings]], serving as the loyal companion (in effect, the manservant) of the protagonist [[Frodo Baggins]]. Sam is a member of the Company of the Ring, the group of nine charged with destroying the One Ring to prevent the Dark Lord Sauron from taking over the world.
other_names: サムワイズ・ギャムジー

title: nerf_maverick_rev-6
body:
The Maverick is a revolver-style blaster with an auto-advancing six-dart cylinder. The Maverick can be reloaded by pressing the button on the left of the blaster to swing the cylinder out, allowing for quick reloading. It has one tactical rail atop the priming slide, followed by a small sight and also a lanyard attachment point. The Maverick's cylinder advances counter-clockwise (when viewed from the front) on trigger pull.

The original blue version of the Maverick is noticeably more powerful than the newer yellow ones, primarily because of a better O-ring.

While the Maverick can accept most Micro Dart and Elite Dart variants, Tagger Micro Darts and Whistler Darts are known to cause jams unless they are fully pushed into the cylinder's barrels.

It was released in 2004

title: the_witcher_(series)
body:
The Witcher (Polish: Wiedźmin) is a series of [[fantasy]] novels written by Polish author Andrzej Sapkowski, adapted into a game series developed by [[CD Projekt RED]], as well as a live action series on [[Netflix]]. The series revolves around the eponymous "witcher," [[Geralt of Rivia]]. In Sapkowski's works, "witchers" are beast hunters who develop supernatural abilities at a young age to battle wild beasts and monsters.

title: twilight
body:
Twilight occurs shortly after [[sunset]] and immediately before [[sunrise]], when the [[sun]]'s light illuminates part of the sky. If any part of the sun is still visible, use one of the aforementioned tags instead. 

Unrelated to [[twilight (series)|the teen vampire book and its succeeding series]].

* !asset #24340888: Twilight occurs twice a day, before sunrise and after sunset
h4.See also

* [[dusk]]: time after sunset with visible sunlight
* [[dawn]]: time before sunrise with visible sunlight
* [[sunrise]] the sun crossing the horizon in the morning
* [[sunset]]: the sun setting beneath the horizon

title: judau_ashta
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He is the main protagonist of the [[Gundam ZZ]] TV anime series from 1986.

[b]Judau Ashta[/b] is the young [[pilot]] of the [[ZZ Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]].

Born in the Shangri-La colony at the Side 1 [[O'Neill Cylinder]], Judau was originally part of a band of teenage [spoilers]newtype[/spoilers] scavengers who sold damaged mobile suit parts and other mechanical junk for money. He has a little sister called [[Leina Ashta]].

A casual encounter with the crew of the MS pilot depleted [[Argama]] and the [[AEUG]] survivors of the last battle of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]] forces Judau to become part of the [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] and use the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] and then the ZZ Gundam against the menace of [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]].

title: anya's_heh_face_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a manga panel of [[Anya (spy x family)|]] from [[SPY x FAMILY]] saying "Heh." with an unintentionally [[smug]] look on her face. A variant on the meme is based on an image of cosplayer "Miyamoto":[https://twitter.com/saki_miyamoto/status/1381947099344822272] "Saki":[https://twitter.com/saki_miyamoto/status/1381943187820802053] wearing a shirt with the smug face, while simultaneously perfectly replicating that very same smug face herself.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Anya's 'Heh' Face / Anya Smug Face":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/anyas-heh-face-anya-smug-face
* "Know Your Meme: Original panel":[https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/002/352/024/93d.jpg]
* "Clip via CrunchyRoll: Heh | SPY x FAMILY":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BR7ASQADexo]

title: melusine_(final_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Melusine (fate)|]] in her Final Ascension outfit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is a rare instance of a character gaining a unique costume for their Final Ascension. She has two long vertical horns, and wears a [[revealing clothes|revealing outfit]] consisting of a white cloth over her breasts, white panties, some black dragon scales, and white dragon wings.

Not to be confused with her [[Melusine (Swimsuit Ruler) (Second Ascension) (fate)|Swimsuit Ruler's second ascension]].

h4. See Also
* [[Melusine (Third Ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]
* [[Melusine (Red Hot Deviation) (fate)|Red Hot Deviation]]

title: omochao
body:
A recurring character in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series, first appearing in [[sonic_adventure_2|Sonic Adventure 2]]. A robotic [[chao_(sonic)|Chao]] with a propeller on his head and a [[winding_key|wind-up key]] on his back. Omochao usually appears as an in-game guide, giving hints to the playable characters during gameplay. He is often seen as an annoyance by most players, regardless. His name comes from 'omocha', the word for 'toy'.

h4. See also
* "Sonic Retro: Omochao":https://info.sonicretro.org/Omochao

title: kronshtadt_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the lead ship (and name ship) of a Soviet large/battle cruiser (project 69) that was only partially built. 
Character designed by [[Dishwasher1910]], voiced by [[Hondo Kaede]].

Her default outfit consists of a two-tone [[double-breasted]] dress, [[pantyhose]], [[thigh strap]]s [[black gloves]], and a large [[fur-trimmed cape|fur-trimmed]] [[white cape]]. She also has a [[sword]] slung to her back waist.

She uses massive [[rigging]] that is in line with the Northern Parliament/Russian faction's ice-crusted animalistic style with her real-life triple-mount main guns arranged in line to face forward.

title: masquerade_mask
body:
Masquerade masks are face masks, commonly worn by the upper class at "Masquerade balls":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masquerade_ball with the purpose of hiding one's identity and expressing oneself.

They have been used in classics such as The Phantom of the Opera, Romeo and Juliet, Lone Ranger, and Gossip Girl. They are still used in many types of media today.

h4. See also
* [[eye mask]]
* [[domino mask]]
* [[Phantom of the Opera]]

title: wentos
body: A mysterious traveling merchant who shows up in various hubs across the world in [i][[Sonic Unleashed]][/i]. He is a shy and secretive figure who roams the world selling items and collectibles to the player, known for his shyness and reluctance to interact directly with customers. To compensate for this, he uses a [[Chao (Sonic)|Chao]] hand puppet to communicate, with the puppet often taking on a more confident and assertive persona during transactions.

title: kumano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kumano[/i]. Character design by [[Pyon-kichi]], voiced by [[Waki Azumi]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[gyaru]] with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[purple eyes]], red [[horns]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit, being a gyaru in theme, appropriately consists of a [[school uniform]] setup with a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], purple [[bowtie]], red [[choker]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown cardigan]] [[cardigan around waist|tied to her waist]], [[black socks]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces each with a single 20.3 cm twin mount and held by her funnel and bridge structure to her back, with triple 610 mm [[torpedo tubes]] [[thigh strap|strapped to her thighs]]. She also has a mast on her back rig containing her [[radar]] set.

title: kiev_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the name ship of her class of destroyers in [[Azur Lane]].

[i]Kiev[/i] was historically designed as a follow-on to the [i]Tashkent[/i]-class design (Project 48/48K) when it became clear that Italian shipbuilding practices were incompatible with the comparatively inferior Soviet shipbuilding industry and practices. [i]Kiev[/i] and her sisters were to be cheaper versions of [i]Tashkent[/i] with virtually the same armament. All were canceled or scrapped by the time of the German invasion of the Soviet Union. Only Kiev by far has been launched and revised as the 48K for post-war reparations but then was scrapped due to material shortages.

Destroyers of her class also have a planned speed about 42.5 knots and one of the destroyers to have an Auxillary gun.

title: aang
body:
The main character of [[Avatar: The Last Airbender]].

In the series, he is the current incarnation of the Avatar, a powerful being capable of controlling all four elements. He is an [[aerokinesis|Airbender]] who is the reincarnation of the previous avatar, [[Roku (Avatar)|]].

[spoiler]After Avatar: The Last Airbender he marries [[Katara]] and their children are [[Kya (legend of korra)|]], [[Tenzin (legend of korra)|]], and [[Bumi (legend of korra)|]]. In [[The Legend of Korra]] his grandchildren are [[Jinora]], [[Ikki (legend of korra)|]], and [[Meelo (legend of korra)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[b]Aang[/b] is [[bald]] with a blue [[arrow_(symbol)|arrow]] [[tattoo]] on his [[forehead]] but when his hair is grown it's [[short hair|short]], [[curly hair|curly]], and [[black hair|black]]. He is usually wearing a red and yellow air nomad attire with a [[staff]].

His animal companions are [[Appa]] and [[Momo (avatar)|]].
other_names: アン(アバター伝説の少年アン)

title: juneau_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]Atlanta[/i]-class light cruiser [i]Juneau[/i] seen in [[azur_lane|Azur Lane]]. She has short, platinum [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]] in a bob cut, as well as a very petite figure. Her rigging consists of several 5”/38 twin mounts on either side, and she appears to be holding a handgun of indeterminate make.

Juneau has an extremely timid personality, traumatized over the events of her sinking. She starts out very afraid of the Commander, and is terrified of physical contact of any kind. She will also make numerous references to the Sullivan Brothers, all five of whom perished when she exploded and sank. 

Note: her [[pixiv]] tag is translated as "Juneau (Union)" to avoid confusion with [[Juno (Azur Lane)|]] as they share the same katakana.

title: criminal_(meitantei_conan)
body:
A stock character from [[Meitantei Conan]], depicted as a black-[[silhouette]]d masculine humanoid figure completely lacking in any distinctive features aside from occasional [[evil smile]].

He is used to represents the mystery culprit while they are committing crimes, destroy the evidence, or even attempted to harm the protagonist and others. The intended usage of this character is to hide the identity of culprit until the mystery is solved.

Due to his ubiquitous appearance throughout the series, along with the occasional discrepancy between him and the culprit's actual look, he has gained [[meme]]tic status in Japan, where he was often called as the "true culprit" behind each crimes and often used as a "generic" villain by various artists for humorous purposes. This has reached the point that he was given his own "spin-off":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Case_Closed:_The_Culprit_Hanzawa which received an anime adaptation in 2022.

title: fairy_tail_logo
body:
A crest of the Fairy Tail guild, the titular magician's guild from the [[Fairy Tail]] series. It appears as a stylized wing of various color.

Like many other guild symbol of the series, it is [[tattoo]]ed onto somewhere of the member's body, typically on the back of their hand or their shoulder.

title: goho_mafia!_kajita-kun
body:
A [[4koma]] comedy series illustrated by [[bkub]] and co-written by [[Mafia Kajita]], who also stars as the manga's host. Frequent guests in the manga include seiyuu [[Sugita Tomokazu]] and [[Nakamura Yuuichi]], and mangaka [[Umino Chika (character)|]], as well as [[duckman|bkub]] himself and [[Fakkuma (character)|]].

Published by Kadokawa, the manga was originally serialized in their monthly 電撃G's magazine from May of 2017 to September of 2020, before transitioning to being serialized directly on Mafia Kajita's Twitter account. Bkub would go on to contribute to future Kajita projects as well, such as [[WashaganaTV]].

title: anilive_jumpstart_program
body:
A program by [[AniLive]] in which aspiring streamers can apply to stream in AniLive and receive a model by doing so. While classified as [[indie virtual youtuber|indies]], they take on the title of the program as if they're a corporate [[virtual YouTuber]]. In it's initial volume, each streamer got a Live2D model, while in its second volume streamers would get PNG models, which were allegedly [[ai-generated|generated by AI]]. Following allegations of AI being used to create its PNG models, AniLive later opted to commission human artists for their PNG models, some of which illustrated models for [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]].

Most of the VTubers in this program have their model artists uncredited, with a few exceptions.

As of December 2024, there are currently 42 members in the program, with at least 10 members who have either undebuted, graduated or left.

[b]Diner Dash[/b] is a strategy and time management videogames series formerly developed by Gamelab and published by PlayFirst and now currently owned by Glu Mobile.

The game follows [[Flo (diner dash)|]], a former stock broker who quits her job due to stress and opens her own diner in the fictional town of Dinertown. Soon Flo begins helping her friends who experience problems with their own restaurants as well.

title: japan_maritime_self-defense_force
body:
The [b]Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force[/b] (海上自衛隊, [i]Kaijou Jieitai[/i], abbreviated as [i]Kaiji[/i] or [i]JMSDF[/i]) is the naval branch of the [[Japan Self-Defense Force]]. It is the modern successor to the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], a position it shares with the [[Japan Coast Guard]].

As it is officially a self-defense force, not a military navy, almost all of the JMSDF's large surface ships are called 護衛艦 ([i]goei-kan[/i], lit. "guard ship" or "escort ship") and officially classed as destroyers. However, the term does not include submarines, mine warfare vessels, variants of patrol boat, landing & transport vessels and training ships. The fact that [[JS Izumo (DDH-183)|Izumo]]-class helicopter carriers with a displacement of nearly 20,000 tons are called "destroyers" is often the butt of jokes.

Unlike the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]], which dropped most traditions associated with the [[Imperial Japanese Army]], the JMSDF still maintains many traditions of its predecessor, the Imperial Japanese Navy. For example, their tradition of eating [[curry rice]] for lunch every weekend was handed down from the IJN.

h4. See also

* [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]
* [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]]
* [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Maritime_Self-Defense_Force

title: japan_self-defense_force
body:
The [b]Japan Self-Defense Forces[/b] (Japanese: 自衛隊, romanized: Jieitai; abbreviated JSDF), also known as the Japanese Armed Forces, are the unified [[military]] forces of [[Japan]] established in 1954.

The self-defence forces consists of the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]], the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]], and the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]. They are controlled by the Ministry of Defense, with the Prime Minister as commander-in-chief.

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Self-Defense_Forces]

title: living_saint
body:
A Living Saint is an extraordinarily devout servant of the Emperor of Mankind, usually a warrior of the Ecclesiarchy, who displays seemingly miraculous, supernatural abilities derived from potent faith in the God-Emperor during his or her lifetime. In almost every case, a Living Saint has been resurrected from the dead, sometimes multiple times. The belief among the faithful of the Imperial Creed is that these individuals are blessed by the Emperor Himself, and are resurrected by His will and grace to defend His servants.

Most of the known Living Saints have been members of the Adepta Sororitas, particularly its Orders Militant, but several have also emerged from the ranks of the Astra Militarum.

In truth, it is clear that Living Saints draw their powers from the Warp much like the servants of Chaos, but are not necessarily psykers during their initial lifetimes. Instead, a Living Saint's faith in the God-Emperor is so great that it allows them to unconsciously draw upon the Warp to fuel supernatural abilities, including the ability to resurrect from death. 

https://warhammer40k.fandom.com/wiki/Living_Saint

Centering around cozy and comfy loungewear, it is a composite costume utilizing her default 2.0 model as a base, and consists of three distinct appearances: one with a [[white shirt|white]] and [[green shirt|green]] [[t-shirt]], one with a [[green sweater]] [[bare shoulders|exposing her shoulders]], and one with a pair of [[pink overalls]] that can go over the shirt, the sweater, or neither, simply showing her [[bra]] underneath.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, her hair is tied into [[twintails]] that is held with a [[green hairband]].

title: hoshimachi_suisei_(maid)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Hoshimachi Suisei]]. Debuted on December 18th 2022.

It's a [[maid]] costume consisting of a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] or [[nurse cap]], a [[black dress|black]] [[collared dress]] with [[see-through cleavage]], [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[side slit]], a [[double-breasted]] [[grey apron]] with a [[chest belt]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[crinoline]], a [[black pantyhose]], and black [[strappy heels]]. She also has an optional double-breasted [[grey coat|grey]] [[trench coat]] with this costume and carries a golden [[halberd|poleaxe]] as a nod to her moniker of "Suicopath".

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]] [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and a [[hairclip]].

title: minor_arcana_(tarot)
body: The Minor Arcana, sometimes known as the Lesser Arcana, are the suit cards in a cartomantic [[tarot]] deck. The typical suits will be Wands (Batons), Swords, Cups, and Pentacles (Coins), but many artists will create custom suits that fit their world building. There are typically 14 cards in each suit, numbered Ace through Ten, and then Page, Knight, Queen, and King, similar to a [[playing_card|poker]] deck.
